page.title: 06COMMONWOOD HOUSE
page.content: {Common Wood House}is about 74 years old. It is a pretty house that used to belong to Mr and Mrs Alan. The Alans built the house with a man called Mr Downer in 1911. It took 30 years to build the house in the Tudor style of architecture. The Alans decided to build in a squash court and an Italian style temple so they made lots of journeys to Italy and looked at a temple there. When the war came they moved out and some Americans moved in and made it into a night club for American officers. In 1955 there was a fire and one third of the house was destroyed. Mr Downer was asked to restore the building. Some years later the house was bought by a London company who made many alterations and modifications and turned it into five flats and two houses. The squash court is likely to be demolished soon.
